alert.note: Alert for Bamberg; Calhoun; Clarendon; Kershaw; Lee; Lexington; Orangeburg; Richland; Sumter (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued January 09 at 2:58PM EST until January 09 at 3:45PM EST by NWS Columbia
info.description: The National Weather Service in Columbia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... West central Lee County in central South Carolina... Calhoun County in central South Carolina... Southwestern Clarendon County in central South Carolina... Central Bamberg County in central South Carolina... Southeastern Lexington County in central South Carolina... Western Sumter County in central South Carolina... Orangeburg County in central South Carolina... Richland County in central South Carolina... Southern Kershaw County in central South Carolina... * Until 345 PM EST. * At 258 PM EST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Arcadia Lakes to 6 miles north of Lodge, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Columbia, Sumter, Orangeburg, Forest Acres, Camden, Bamberg, Dentsville, Shaw Air Base, McEntire Air Base, Brookdale, St. Matthews, Holly Hill, Branchville, Bowman, Arcadia Lakes, Eastover, Elloree, Lugoff, Oakland, and Santee State Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 71 and 108. Interstate 26 between mile markers 123 and 169. Interstate 77 between mile markers 4 and 24. Interstate 95 between mile markers 85 and 105. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Severe thunderstorms can produce large capsizing waves and frequent lightning. If on or near Lake Marion move away from the water and take shelter! A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EST for central South Carolina.

area.areaDesc: Bamberg; Calhoun; Clarendon; Kershaw; Lee; Lexington; Orangeburg; Richland; Sumter
